name: 'Opposition Research' Multiple Choice Quiz | 'West Wing' - Season 6 | 10 Questions

questions.text: What did Santos want the campaign to be about?
questions.explanation:
Ideas.

	Josh and Santos were driving into New Hampshire and talking about the campaign as they tried to figure out where they were.

questions.text: The reporter that Josh talked outside a house in New Hampshire was from what newspaper?
questions.explanation:
New York Times.

	Josh met with Greg Brock outside a house in New Hampshire and Greg mentioned that someone from the "Washington Post" was also in New Hampshire. What Greg didn't tell Josh until later was that both newspapers were doing a story on Josh leaving the White House for the Santos campaign.

questions.text: How many times did Josh say a candidate had to have coffee in someone's house before they would vote for you?
questions.explanation:
five.

	Josh explained to Santos that New Hampshire was a state of retail politics. Retail politics means addressing one person's concerns.

questions.text: Did Santos make the quote about New Hampshire being as diverse as a Mayflower reunion?
questions.explanation:
Yes.

	Santos told Josh he made the quote eight years ago. The quote had already been given the nickname Mayflowergate and Josh said there was no way it was a "gate" already.

questions.text: Where was Santos campaign headquarters set up in New Hampshire?
questions.explanation:
Sporting goods store.

	The sporting goods store called Laraby's Sporting Goods and its motto was "Lose your boat, we'll help you float". Josh referred to the store as "launching the campaign from the hull of the Titanic".

questions.text: When Santos was talking about literacy, what rank did he say the United States had with literacy?
questions.explanation:
49th.

	Santos said the United States ranked 49th in literacy and in the past 50 years the United States went down 18 points.

questions.text: Donna called the Santos campaign a Doctor Seuss nightmare?
questions.explanation:
Yes.

	"One fish, two fish, we fought the good fight fish" and Josh said that it was opposed to the Russell campaign which was "the cat in the imitation hat fell flat".

questions.text: Which candidate's letter opener did Josh see Senator Butler using to open an envelope?
questions.explanation:
Russell.

	When Josh made mention of the Russell letter opener, Senator Butler said he received the Russell cup holders last month.

questions.text: Who did Josh bring in to do opposition research on Santos?
questions.explanation:
Joey.

	Joey's research on Santos found that Santos' brother finished high school but couldn't read and that Santos had been supporting his brother financially for the past five years.

questions.text: How much money did Elizabeth Bartlet Westin give Josh for the Santos campaign?
questions.explanation:
$2,000.

	Elizabeth gave Josh a $2000 dollar check for the campaign knowing that it would show up in newspapers that a Bartlet gave the Santos campaign money. Josh told Ronna to use the money for Santos letter openers.
